metadata.questions_this_excerpt_can_answer:
1. How does the "Adopt a Tree" project aim to address the lack of education and information hindering the development of forest cover and soil conservation in the target community?
2. What specific objectives does the "Adopt a Tree" project have in terms of increasing tree cover, providing environmental education, and creating healthy learning environments for children?
3. How does the "Adopt a Tree" project plan to engage both primary school learners and their parents in planting trees, particularly fruit trees, to increase tree cover and provide nutritional benefits to the community?

__data__.text:
https://hackmd.io/@Eliud88/r1Kmq7UQ6
Name of Project: Adopt a Tree
Executive summary
This is an education project that is aimed at teaching primary school learners on tree planting and engaging in planting trees in their schools and at their homes. In this plan, child will take care of the trees they plant up to maturity: adopt a tree! This will be coupled with education on climate change and proper soil maintenance practices.
Problem statement
The members of the target community are in dire need to develop and increase their forest cover and secure their water catchment areas and improve their soil conservation. Lack of requisite education and information is the main hinderance to these
Project Justification
The main target of this project is to increase the tree cover and imparting climate education to the young population so that we have climate conscious generation.
This is an environmental program that is designed as a means of conserving the environment with particular emphasis to schools and the communities around them. This program has among its components, issues that address health, water and sanitation, environmental awareness, tree planting with particular emphasis to multipurpose trees and species especially fruit trees for nutrition in schools and woody trees for the community.
The overall target is engaging all schools in this program
Project objective:
The overall objective of this project is to increase tree cover while providing generations of children with healthy nutrition options and environmental education
Specific Objectives
• To plant different species of trees in schools and the surrounding community
• To pass on environment education for protection of our environment.
• To provide good learning environments for children
Project justification
Engaging primary schools in planting trees will see us reach many people both in the schools and around the community. When all the children are engaged in adopting trees, it will ensure that most of the trees survive to maturity and in so doing, there will be increase in tree cover. Planting fruit trees will be more encouraging as the children will have nutritional benefits form the fruits.
As we engage the children in climate education and setting up tree nurseries their parents too will be involved in planting the surplus seedlings generated.
Project activities
• Environment Awareness
This will help the learners and their parents learn the value of planting trees, especially fruit trees and how to care for them

• Environment Awareness
This will help the learners and their parents learn the value of planting trees, especially fruit trees and how to care for them with emphasis on environmental conservation
• Demonstrations on Nursery Tree Establishments
The target beneficiaries will be taught how to stablish tree nurseries, care for trees and also simple techniques of breeding such as grafting plants for better quality breeds.
• Tree planting
This shall involve teachers, parents and the learners. The seedlings will be from the tree nurseries established in schools. The learners will be taught how to raise trees and each will be given seedlings to plant and tend to. They will plant at least three trees both at school and at home. The parents too will plant trees at their homes.
• Monitoring and Evaluation
There will be participatory monitoring and evaluation
Methodology of implementation
There shall be a dipartite partnership involving the teachers, learners and the parents. The contribution of each party will be as follows:
• Teachers
• Project design, planning & management
• Acquisition of seeds
• Technical support and oversight on tree planting and management
• Training of selected schools
• Monitor and evaluate
• Produce report and accountability
• Learners and parents
• Planting and maintenance of trees
• Maintenance of tree nurseries
When you educate a child about climate change, you educate a whole generation!

metadata.document_title: "Rewilding Revolution: NFTs, Regenerative Finance, and Virtual Sanctuaries - A Comprehensive Guide to Rewilding Projects, Game Development, and Web3 Integration for Conservation"
metadata.questions_this_excerpt_can_answer:
1. How does Wild Friends utilize Web3 technology to support rewilding projects and wildlife sanctuaries?
2. What unique features does the digital collectibles (NFTs) offered by Wild Friends provide for users in the rewilding game?
3. How does the collaboration between Wild Friends and Senda Verde Bolivia contribute to the rewilding and regeneration efforts in the ecosystem?

__data__.text:
We are creating a platform for rewilding projects around the world to adopt Web3 technology to educate and receive donations. The educational experience starts by engaging the user by giving them the option to sponsor a digital version of an animal at a sanctuary (through NFTs), which will become his learning partner to the world of rewilding.
Visit wildfriends.xyz for more information.
Adopt a virtual animal and rewild the world - in collaboration with Senda Verde Bolivia
wildfriends.xyz
A game to support rewilding projects and wildlife sanctuaries through digital collectibles (NFTs) that represent the different species required to regenerate an ecosystem. These digital collectibles will be used to unlock different pollinators, plants, trees and animals inside the game, with which you will earn daily rewards and get boosted for funding and learning about the right combinations of species to rewild ecosystems. Your companion throughout the game will be a digital collectible of an animal at a wildlife sanctuary, whose environment you’ll be a able to customise through the rewards earned with your rewilding and regeneration efforts. The pilot for this project is Senda Verde, an exotic animal shelter in Bolivia.
Guided by the fact that conservation and pure reforestation/carbon capture is not enough to restore the ecosystem, our vision is to change people’s minds about climate efforts to a regenerative focus with the goal of recreating a world richer in nature where wildlife thrives. We have seen a tremendous opportunity to expand the rewilding model with web3, thanks to recent advances in regenerative finance and support for public goods.
Among the opportunities that web3 brings, we have identified 3 relevant uses for Wild Friends that can be expanded to other rewilding projects and wildlife sanctuaries:
Open source allows this model to be replicable to more rewilding projects and to create a network of mutually supporting projects and sanctuaries.
NFTs and SBTs (Soulbound tokens) to raise funds, educate and reward volunteers, artists and donors who support these projects, starting with Senda Verde.
A video game to connect with rewilding projects and wildlife sanctuaries without the need to physically visit them.
Volunteers, artists and the Senda Verde team stand out for their ability

metadata.document_title: "Rewilding Revolution: NFTs, Regenerative Finance, and Virtual Sanctuaries - A Comprehensive Guide to Rewilding Projects, Game Development, and Web3 Integration for Conservation"
metadata.questions_this_excerpt_can_answer:
1. How can Wild Friends and Senda Verde Bolivia use NFTs and SBTs to raise funds, educate volunteers, artists, and donors, and create a sense of community around rewilding projects and wildlife sanctuaries?
2. What is the potential for digital collectibles (in the form of NFTs) created from art inspired by visiting Senda Verde to generate income and support sustainability for the sanctuary?
3. How does the video game developed by Wild Friends provide an engaging and interactive way for collectors to interact with digital versions of animals, learn about rewilding, and support different rewilding projects?

__data__.text:
have identified 3 relevant uses for Wild Friends that can be expanded to other rewilding projects and wildlife sanctuaries:
Open source allows this model to be replicable to more rewilding projects and to create a network of mutually supporting projects and sanctuaries.
NFTs and SBTs (Soulbound tokens) to raise funds, educate and reward volunteers, artists and donors who support these projects, starting with Senda Verde.
A video game to connect with rewilding projects and wildlife sanctuaries without the need to physically visit them.
Volunteers, artists and the Senda Verde team stand out for their ability to create art inspired by the experience of visiting the sanctuary and sharing with the animals, listening to their stories and transmitting them to the world.
These works of art (painting, photography, video, drawing or even music) thanks to web3 have a lot of potential to generate an income that will help to give sustainability to Senda Verde. So we will use them to create digital collectibles (in the form of NFTs) that not only crowdfund for these projects, but also create social awareness, entertainment, engagement and a sense of community to educate people about the importance of regeneration of the environment to effectively recover from the climate crisis.
We are creating an engaging and interactive way to motivate the purchase and use of these digital collectibles. The form is a video game where collectors can interact with digital versions of the animals, and create the right combinations of pollinators and plants, while collecting artwork and visit the environments of their friends. The “book of collectibles” will function as a "Green Passport" to show your friends the different rewilding projects you supported, the art of the animals and even get access to cameras in those wildlife sanctuaries.
For our MVP we developed a simple game in Unity where you can move, feed and give water to an animal. We also have a basic environment customization system which aims to educate about how rewilding works. As of now we have 4 playable animals: jaguar, bear, caiman and deer, 1 pollinator and more than 20 plants to combine.
For the Web3 implementations, we used Bonfire to build our website and to token-gate the page with the

metadata.document_title: "Rewilding Revolution: NFTs, Regenerative Finance, and Virtual Sanctuaries - A Comprehensive Guide to Rewilding Projects, Game Development, and Web3 Integration for Conservation"
metadata.questions_this_excerpt_can_answer:
1. How did Wild Friends utilize Bonfire and Decent for their rewilding project and game development?
2. What animals are currently playable in Wild Friends' Unity game and how many plants can be combined in the environment customization system?
3. How did Wild Friends use funds received during the Devcon VI Bogota CLR QF Round to develop their MVP and what are their plans for further development and expansion of the project?

__data__.text:
show your friends the different rewilding projects you supported, the art of the animals and even get access to cameras in those wildlife sanctuaries.
For our MVP we developed a simple game in Unity where you can move, feed and give water to an animal. We also have a basic environment customization system which aims to educate about how rewilding works. As of now we have 4 playable animals: jaguar, bear, caiman and deer, 1 pollinator and more than 20 plants to combine.
For the Web3 implementations, we used Bonfire to build our website and to token-gate the page with the game embed. Decent was used to mint the NFTs that give you access to the different animals.
As our project gains more traction, we will develop our own systems to tackle these problems and make them open-source and accessible so that more projects can plug-in to the game and benefit from these efforts.
We received a lot of support during the Devcon VI Bogota CLR QF Round, and we used those funds to develop our MVP. Now that we have a proof of concept and have received a lot of attention from big players in the ecosystem, we want to level up the game mechanics and focus those resources in hiring another game developer, while continuing with our marketing and partnership efforts. At the same time, we need to abstract away all the web3 touch points (connecting wallet, etc...), so that the user can experience the game without going through that steep learning curve.

metadata.EGS Provider: Endangered Tokens DAO: Endangered Trees as ReFi Biodiversity Assets & Public Registry

__data__.text:
The world needs the creation of new incentives that can redesign the coordination of actions that our species have been driving since industrial revolution.
Endangered Tokens DAO is a ReFi NFT community looking to revalue biodiversity and incentivize regeneration by tokenizing endangered trees with web3 preserve&earn incentives and digital value added with content, technology and real world impact.

TLDR: What's new since the Last round?
-Virtual Reality Endangered Arboretum Experience first POC ready.
-First approach and feedbacks of the VR experience within 2 different crypto events.
-Decentralized ecosystemic services of trees verification app: ENTS DAPP V1.0 Ready on Figma and already in development.
-OGT credits Class first feedbacks by scientific proffesional
-Participation on EBC Blockchain Convention
-Tokenomics rethinking
-Applying to government grants
Problem to Solve
Endangered trees are responsible for maintaining the health of most of the world's endangered forest ecosystems, but rarely produce relevant revenue for landowners (without being damaged) and even become financial liabilities, thus encouraging their ilegal felling.
Endangered Tokens’ Solution
Leverage web3 and digital art to incentivize the protection of these scarce beings by changing their status from merely the cost of maintaining a tree to a revenue producing Bio-Asset.
To foster the protection of endangered trees by bestowing them with tangible value in society.
To create a world where endangered and long lived trees are not only preserved but also revered for their intrinsic value, fostering a harmonious coexistence between nature and society.

Endangered Tokens is a ReFi & DeSci NFT community looking to revalue biodiversity by tokenizing georeferenced endangered trees. We are building a real life impact coordination game in which users can receive rewards for verifying georreferenced trees with their phones. Each specimen is characterized and video recorded alongside a small verse description, and when owning one, you become the godfather of a scarce endangered tree!
With the funds raised we will help landowners finance the protection of endangered Forest with reforestation, verification of carbon credits from the forests and the creation of quality digital content & data to add value to the tokens, content

metadata.questions_this_excerpt_can_answer:

2. What kind of real-life impact coordination game is being developed by Tokens, and how can users participate in verifying georeferenced trees?
3. How does the Endangered Tokens DAO plan to use the funds raised to finance the protection of endangered forests, including activities such as reforestation, verification of carbon credits, and creation of digital content?

metadata.EGS Provider: Endangered Tokens DAO: Endangered Trees as ReFi Biodiversity Assets & Public Registry
Endangered Tokens DAO: Endangered Trees as ReFi Biodiversity Assets & Public Registry

__data__.text:
Tokens is a ReFi & DeSci NFT community looking to revalue biodiversity by tokenizing georeferenced endangered trees. We are building a real life impact coordination game in which users can receive rewards for verifying georreferenced trees with their phones. Each specimen is characterized and video recorded alongside a small verse description, and when owning one, you become the godfather of a scarce endangered tree!
With the funds raised we will help landowners finance the protection of endangered Forest with reforestation, verification of carbon credits from the forests and the creation of quality digital content & data to add value to the tokens, content like:
Inmersive UX for ReFi Assets, to engage with web3 enthusiasts and show the value of each token as seen in real life.
3D tourism experience of the protected forests thus reducing the footprint of real life tourism while also generating a continuous flow of revenue to keep supporting the protection of the forests.
Using the 3D replicas of each tree as a virtual asset for video games and/or augmented reality experiences
Recording data from the forest for research and enhanced digital experiences like music from the frequencies of the trees, bioacoustics, video recording of the ecosystems, climate data, water flow, among other relevant information.
NFT holders will receive a portion of the revenue that will come from the NFT Sales, tourism experiences, data management and carbon credits, thus converting endangered trees from liabilities to biodiversity assets for the future.
We are also developing a new type of Credit Class for Old Grown Trees (OGT credit Class) so any type of big tree can become a way of proving your positive impact in the world and a way of financing its protection, instead of cutting them down for wood. Details in projects below.
We are currently working in Chile in South america, with the rare species Gomortega Keule, or locally known as Queule. This magnificent beings are the last one of the Gomortegacae Family, dating its evolution to Pangea times. It is estimated that there are no more than 4000 specimens alive in the world! (Scarcer than Bitcoin!)

With the help of past Gitcoin Grants we are also making contacts and reviewing possible projects with the Brazilian

We are currently working in Chile in South america, with the rare species Gomortega Keule, or locally known as Queule. This magnificent beings are the last one of the Gomortegacae Family, dating its evolution to Pangea times. It is estimated that there are no more than 4000 specimens alive in the world! With the help of past Gitcoin Grants we are also making contacts and reviewing possible projects with the Brazilian Tree "Pau Brasil" or Paubrasilia echinata an endangered Species of tree from which the country got it's name! The heavily abused lumbering by portuguese conquerors depleted their population and nowadays is a rare and unique living being.
We are developing a roadmap of species to keep onboarding, like Alerce, Pitao, Araucaria, Baobab, Sequoia, and others.
As of the date of this 19th round of Gitcoin Grants (#GG19 lets go!) we have raised around 30000 DAI through Gitcoin that we have spent cautiously and also have some saved for our roadmap goals. Without Gitcoin this project would not be able to keep moving forward as we have. We thank every supporter and every sponsor of the Climate Rounds.

In order to fully convert our protected trees to biodiversity Assets we thought a way to represent them as credits. The OGT Credits system allows landowners to register their Old Grown Trees through the ENTS DAPP, a user-friendly application. Once registered, these trees transform into 'credits' based on their age and conservation status. Landowners can then monetize these credits, creating a compelling economic reason to preserve these trees.
OGT Credit class document draft - Comments accepted

These trees are not just any trees; they are rare and endangered species that need our help to survive. By collecting these trees, players contribute to the conservation of these species, learn about their unique characteristics, and help preserve the biodiversity of our planet.

Alongside the virtual experience we are recording the frequencies of the endangered trees through a PlantsPlay device (www.plantsplay.com) as the first approach. Our vision is to be able to stream the music of the endangered trees live, so they can produce their own content to help them stay alive.

metadata.document_title: "Promoting Transparency and Accountability in Waste Treatment through Oxygenchain Technology"
metadata.questions_this_excerpt_can_answer:
1. How does Oxygenchain incentivize transparency and accountability in waste treatment?
2. What technologies does Oxygenchain utilize to monitor and track environmental data in real-time?
3. How does Oxygenchain's rewards system encourage municipalities, industries, and property owners to comply with environmental regulations and demonstrate their commitment to sustainability?

metadata.EGS Provider: Endangered Tokens DAO: Endangered Trees as ReFi Biodiversity Assets & Public Registry

__data__.text:
Oxygenchain Incentivizes transparency and creates accountability in waste treatment.

Half of the world’s liquid waste is dumped into our rivers, lakes and oceans untreated. Inefficient systems, lack of resources, and centralized environmental agencies all contribute to falling short of a solution people deserve.
Two main reasons for the failure of current initiatives are; lack of transparency and misaligned incentives. Because data is opaque, it is: difficult to validate, hard to enforce results, and creates a lack of accountability.
Incentivize the monitoring of our most valuable resources using real-time data collected through multi-parameter IoT sensors, flow rate meters and more to create an immutable record of history, while calculating differences from incoming and outgoing readings to generate rewards. Oxygenchain is ready to power new economies with tangible results providing accountability, transparency and emphasizing efficiency to the public.
By proving that their activities are not contaminating the planet, participants will receive a reward, which will encourage them to continue to operate in an environmentally friendly manner.
The rewards system incentivizes municipalities, industries, small companies and property owners to comply with environmental regulations and provides a clear way for them to demonstrate their commitment to sustainability.

Oxygenchain aims to create a platform that encourages environmental responsibility and helps mitigate the impact of pollution on our planet.

[System overview]

metadata.document_title: "Advancing EverGreenCoin: Redesigning, Modernizing, and Globalizing for a Sustainable Future"
metadata.questions_this_excerpt_can_answer:
1. How has EverGreenCoin evolved and matured over the years since its launch in 2015, and what specific programs, such as Proof of Environment, have been developed as a result?
2. What specific advancements and updates are being proposed for EverGreenCoin, including the redesign of the website and the rebase of the core wallet software codebase, to enhance user experience and future-proof the network?
3. How does EverGreenCoin plan to secure grant funding to compensate developers and support full-time advancement of the platform, with the ultimate goal of bringing the cryptocurrency to the global stage and establishing it as a pillar of sustainability in the industry?

__data__.text:
EverGreenCoin® (EGC) cryptocurrency is an X15 PoW/PoS hybrid launched in 2015 with no pre-mine, no instamine, no pre-sale, no ICO. The EverGreenCoin Foundation, Inc., is a 501(c)3 public charity operating under the laws of the state of Ohio, USA. Over the many years, the project, ecosystem, and platform have evolved and matured in many ways, as has the industry.
Proof of Environment is a program of EverGreenCoin's that rewards environmentally-conscious tasks and observations monthly and is a product of the many years of the project's growth. To take EverGreenCoin and its, what has become, flagship program of Proof of Environment to the next level, our website needs redesigned to streamline participation into a more user-friendly experience Internet users expect, and our core wallet software codebase needs to be rebased to future-proof our network and keep with the progression of blockchain technology.
The EverGreenCoin foundation and community are requesting grant monies to fairly compensate developers and to keep in-house developers working on advancing the platform full-time. We strongly believe our concept is already proven but does need revamping and modernizing. We are certain we can develop and bring our platform to the global stage and make EverGreenCoin a pillar of good in our industry's history and future.

metadata.EGS Provider: The Solar Foundation & GoodDollar: Solar + UBI to Empower Women in Uganda
metadata.document_title: Empowering Women in Rural Uganda with Solar Energy, Universal Basic Income, and Blockchain Technology
metadata.questions_this_excerpt_can_answer:
1. How is the Solar Foundation utilizing blockchain technology to empower women in rural Uganda with solar energy and Universal Basic Income?
2. What specific benefits have been observed from small solar solutions in rural, low-income communities in emerging economies?
3. How does the Solar + UBI pilot project in collaboration with GoodDollar aim to address energy poverty, close the digital divide, empower women, and increase climate resilience in Uganda's Tororo District?

metadata.EGS Provider: The Solar Foundation & GoodDollar: Solar + UBI to Empower Women in Uganda

__data__.text:
Bridging the digital divide via solar energy for women in rural Uganda
50 women, 50 mobile phones, 50 off-grid solar devices, 50 social solar entrepreneurs... powered by blockchain public goods; brought to you by the Solar Foundation & GoodDollar.
The Solar Foundation’s mission is to fund and accelerate off-grid solar solutions for underserved communities in emerging economies. We believe decentralized solar energy is a public good and we’ve witnessed how small solar solutions in rural, low-income communities unlock profound, real-life, tangible benefits. We are utilizing new technologies such as the blockchain to develop innovative, sustainable funding models to enable more people to access clean energy with an ownership stake in the solar deployed.
For GG19, our grant will focus on raising funds for an innovative Solar + UBI pilot project in collaboration with GoodDollar, and with Ayowecca Uganda as our local partner. The project aims to utilize G$, a blockchain-enabled Universal Basic Income (UBI), to deliver digital connectivity and clean energy to 50 women who currently lack phones and direct access to electricity. This multi-faceted approach has the potential to develop an open-source, scalable model to address energy poverty, close the digital divide, empower women and increase climate resilience.
Are you looking for a way to take meaningful, sustainable climate action that impacts real lives? Please support our #GG19 grant and join our efforts to accelerate solar in underserved communities.
Photo courtesy of Ayowecca Uganda
The Solar Foundation has completed off-grid solar projects in Uganda, Nigeria and Puerto Rico (please see the The Solar Foundation website for details and pictures). We are now working on a Solar + UBI pilot project with GoodDollar, a blockchain-based UBI protocol, that aims to empower 50 women in Uganda’s Tororo District to receive digital funds to purchase mobile minutes and contribute towards the ownership of a small, expandable solar energy system. The selected women currently borrow phones and rely on small, locally made, unhealthy kerosene lamps for lighting as shown below in the photo of children studying during the evening.
Photo courtesy of Ayowecca Uganda
Equitable access to renewable energy, technology and financial products is critical for ensuring economic empowerment, community resilience and climate adaptation.

metadata.EGS Provider: The Solar Foundation & GoodDollar: Solar + UBI to Empower Women in Uganda
metadata.document_title: Empowering Women in Rural Uganda with Solar Energy, Universal Basic Income, and Blockchain Technology
metadata.questions_this_excerpt_can_answer:
1. How is the Solar Foundation collaborating with GoodDollar and Ayowecca Uganda to empower women in Uganda's Tororo District through a Solar + UBI pilot project?
2. What specific resources and support are being provided to the selected women in the pilot project, including off-grid solar energy systems, smartphones, and digital UBI?
3. How does the collaboration between The Solar Foundation, GoodDollar, and Ayowecca Uganda aim to create a replicable model for remote communities in emerging economies, focusing on economic empowerment, community resilience, and climate adaptation?

metadata.EGS Provider: The Solar Foundation & GoodDollar: Solar + UBI to Empower Women in Uganda
The Solar Foundation & GoodDollar: Solar + UBI to Empower Women in Uganda

__data__.text:
pictures). We are now working on a Solar + UBI pilot project with GoodDollar, a blockchain-based UBI protocol, that aims to empower 50 women in Uganda’s Tororo District to receive digital funds to purchase mobile minutes and contribute towards the ownership of a small, expandable solar energy system. The selected women currently borrow phones and rely on small, locally made, unhealthy kerosene lamps for lighting as shown below in the photo of children studying during the evening.
Photo courtesy of Ayowecca Uganda
Equitable access to renewable energy, technology and financial products is critical for ensuring economic empowerment, community resilience and climate adaptation. We believe that this blockchain-enabled solution will create an open-source, replicable model for remote communities in emerging economies.
This proof-of-concept implementation is a collaboration among three partners:
The Solar Foundation: Our mission is to leverage blockchain-enabled tools to fund and accelerate solar adoption in underserved communities. We believe in a just transition to clean energy and have witnessed the exponential benefits of small solar solutions.
GoodDollar: Widely recognized by the World Economic Forum and the Crypto Council for Innovation, GoodDollar makes digital payments and assets accessible to underserved regions, with over 650,000 users worldwide.
Ayowecca Uganda: Our partner NGO in Tororo, Uganda, is an agroforestry and regenerative community led organization with a focus on empowering women and girls. We have an established working relationship with Ayowecca’s director, Jonathan Olwenyi, who will act as an on-the-ground community facilitator.
For this pilot, each woman will receive a small, off-grid solar energy system (50W panel and 142Wh battery); a mobile smartphone and a digital UBI to pay for the solar system and mobile data. We are excited to see the positive ripple effects of creating a local micro-economy; we believe there will be many potential benefits to empowering women and closing the gender digital divide, as shown in the graphic below:

For more detailed information and project plans, please see The Solar Foundation website
To learn more about GoodDollar, visit the GoodDollar website

metadata.EGS Provider: Solarpunk Nomads: Nomad Hub and Climate Resilience Tracker
metadata.document_title: "The Rise of Solarpunk Nomadism: Building a Sustainable Future on the Move"
metadata.questions_this_excerpt_can_answer:
1. How are Solarpunk Nomads using zero-carbon emission vehicles to accelerate the transition towards a sustainable and climate-resilient society?
2. What tools and platforms are the Solarpunk Nomads developing to help regenerators monitor and improve their individual Climate Change Resilience?
3. How have Solarpunk Nomads utilized a gamified digital platform, the Nomad Hub, to explore the world of Solarpunk Nomads and discover the first ever Solarpunk?

metadata.EGS Provider: Solarpunk Nomads: Nomad Hub and Climate Resilience Tracker
The Solar Foundation & GoodDollar: Solar + UBI to Empower Women in Uganda

__data__.text:
Since early 2022, we have been collectively developing the concept of Solarpunk Nomadism.
From concept development, to the creation of the first two vehicles, their use on the ground and a series of co-creating workshops in India and Europe.
All the vehicles created by us are community-owned and employed to accelerate the transition towards a sustainable and climate-resilient society.

WHO ARE THE SOLARPUNK NOMADS
Changemakers, dreamers, and builders who live nomadic or semi-nomadic lifestyles using zero-carbon emission vehicles - such as EV vans, EV bikes, sailboats or even traveling on foot- powered by renewable energies.

👉These nomads remain constantly connected to the internet through satellite connections and are proactive in forging a Solarpunk society.
👉 They are the storytellers and primary catalysts of a society where technology and ecological wisdom converge to craft a brighter future for all.
WHAT WE WANT TO BUILD
🔜 Build the Climate Tracker tool to help regenerators monitor and improve their individual Climate Change Resilience. [2023]
🔜 Develop an Interactive Map of the Future featuring Nomads, Safe Places, Routes and Tribes. [2023]
🔜 Complete the Nomad Hub, a gamified digital platform for the nomads. [2024]

🔜 Complete Solarpunk World Building, a decentralized set of tools to leverage collective creativity to envision a Solarpunk Future. [2024]
🔜 Build the Solarpunk Nomads DApp to assist traveling changemakers in:
-monitoring and reducing CO2 emissions [2024]
-accessing community vehicles and safe places [2024]
-leveraging regenerative activities at the local level [2025]

WHAT WE HAVE BUILT SO FAR [DURING 2023]
✔️ Completed a European Tour of Solarpunk World Building IRL workshops with events happening in London, Amsterdam and Berlin. 3+ months of travelling using only a bike, busses and trains. 🚫✈️
✔️ The first version of the Nomad Hub, a gamified digital platform where:
-you can explore the world of Solarpunk Nomads
-you can discover the first ever Solarpunk

WHY IS SOLARPUNK NOMADISM A CLIMATE SOLUTION?
🌳 Promotes sustainable mobility, electrification, renewables adoption and climate resilience through Educational Workshops, Real Life Prototypes and the building of innovative web2/web3 tools.
🌳 Leverages nomadism to promote the Solarpunk vision.
🌳 Helps changemakers to increase their personal Climate Change Resilience and to maintain functionality in challenging times.
🌳 Helps to reduce the carbon footprint of the community.
🌳 Promotes minimalism and a rethinking of lifestyle toward sustainability.
🌳 Has very high potential scalability inside and outside the Web3 Space.

metadata.document_title: "Kokonut Network: Revolutionizing Agriculture and Empowering Underserved Communities Through Eco-Friendly Blockchain Technology and Community Engagement"
metadata.questions_this_excerpt_can_answer:
1. How is Kokonut Network revolutionizing agriculture and empowering underserved communities through eco-friendly blockchain technology and community engagement?
2. What updates and developments have occurred in Kokonut Network from August 2023 to November 2023, and what can be expected in Q4-23 and Q1 2024?
3. How does Kokonut Network leverage blockchain governance and open-source accounting in the agricultural sector, and what unique features does the Kokonut DAO framework offer for funding and decision-making within the community?

metadata.EGS Provider: Solarpunk Nomads: Nomad Hub and Climate Resilience Tracker

__data__.text:
Wouldn’t it be nice to create a perpetual framework backed by natural assets unrelated to the crypto market, and eco-friendly and regenerative?
I’m Wasabi, founder of Kokonut Network. We are building a bridge to connect web3 and agriculture. We are creating a blockchain-based cooperative to develop and manage a network of coconut farms.
Our main goal is to address the worldwide lack of funding for agricultural projects. We partner with farmers to get the funds they need while creating opportunities for web3 communities by giving them access to perpetual natural assets.
Kokonut Network leverages blockchain governance and open-source accounting into the agricultural sector. Our mission is to encourage, organize, finance, and oversee coconut farms. We gather funds from the community using the Kokonut DAO framework to make decisions and allocate treasury funds.
Kokonut Network forge a lifelong partnership with its members through the Kokonut DAO, utilizing a combination of Agriculture, Blockchain, Web3, Soil, and Weather. This synergy has no expiration date, due to the fact that coconut trees are replanted when they cease to bear fruits.

WHO – The families who own the land where the project will be developed are underserved in every aspect, including education, finances, health, and opportunities. In Latin America, jobs and the economy mainly function in big cities, and the countryside is typically marginalized or taken advantage of by large corporations. A blockchain-based co-op can help remove many of these barriers.

metadata.document_title: "Kokonut Network: Revolutionizing Agriculture and Empowering Underserved Communities Through Eco-Friendly Blockchain Technology and Community Engagement"
metadata.questions_this_excerpt_can_answer:
1. How does Kokonut Network aim to revolutionize agriculture and empower underserved communities through eco-friendly blockchain technology and community engagement?
2. What specific fail safes does Kokonut Network have in place to mitigate risks associated with their agricultural projects?
3. How does Kokonut Network plan to utilize blockchain technology to establish multiple plantations across the country and democratize investment in real-world projects?

__data__.text:
60 families own the land, and the project will create 1,000 direct and indirect jobs. This will be life-changing for everyone involved, as it will provide opportunities and value for at least 20 years.
CONTRIBUTION – Underserved individuals depend on these types of projects and new concepts based on blockchain that open doors to new paradigms and possibilities. The current system's criteria and entry-level are very high, making it difficult for those who cannot meet their standards.
RISK – We have several fail safes in place, such as agricultural insurance, open-source cloud accounting systems, government and community oversight, and technical support from all government agencies involved in the project framework.
In essence, Kokonut Network serves as the coordination layer that harnesses the power of web3 and open-source technologies to craft an adaptable organism capable of limitless expansion, thanks to its modular plug-and-play design framework.
Every component of our network is crafted in alignment with our core values: community first, work and respect for diverse opinions.
Our commitment extends to safeguarding the interests of minorities through a holistic approach.
Our approach is different, as evidenced by our roadmap.
Kokonut Network Diagram Swim lane Chart
Zero Waste & Circular By Default Crop ♻️
Coconut is the most cultivated and vital palm tree in the world, as it is the main source of vegetable fat. It is one of the plants that provide a wide variety of products and by-products, serving as a primary source of food, drinks, and shelter for animals.
The coconut products market size was valued at $11.5 billion in 2018 and is estimated to reach $31.1 billion by 2026, registering a CAGR of 13.6% from 2019 to 2026. In 2018, the coconut oil segment accounted for more than half of the total coconut products market share.
Coconut is a versatile fruit with many health benefits.
Kokonut Network was created to reduce the obstacles to agricultural development, rural project funding, and democratize investment in real-world projects. We will use blockchain technology to establish multiple plantations across the country, creating opportunities for the global web3 communities and everyone in the network.

metadata.document_title: Advancing Regenerative Agriculture and Climate Resilience in Kenya: Driving Technology and Community Building for Carbon Credit Verification
metadata.questions_this_excerpt_can_answer:
1. How is Shamba Network using satellite data, geospatial analytics, and AI to monitor and report ecological state globally?
2. How many smallholder farmers have been onboarded to Shamba Network's digital MRV tools, and what is the goal of providing this verification service for small-scale projects?
3. How is Shamba Network building a local regenerative community in Kenya through events like the ReFi Kenya festival, and how are they using funds from their GG18 round to support these community-building efforts?

__data__.text:
We are developing dMRV and associated tools to drive climate change adaptation and mitigation projects, focusing on small farmers. We are also building a Regen community across Kenya.
We use satellite data, geospatial analytics, and AI to monitor and report ecological state globally.
We run an ecological data oracle to provide the web3 ecosystem with on-demand ecological data.
This data from our oracle is currently used for 2 purposes:
Ecological data is used to assess risks over an area and this drives insurance and other climate resilience products.
An example of this is the Diva Donate pilot, a solution that provides finances to drought-affected communities through donation-driven insurance.
Read more at this link:
[Diva Donate link
We are developing digital MRV tools for verification of ecological impact. Our goal is to provide an efficient and low-cost verification service optimized for small-scale projects.
We have been developing our dMRV solutions with the participation of smallholder farmers. The tools and solutions we have developed are designed to help farming communities manage regen projects. Over 6000 farmers have been onboarded to these tools with more on the waitlist.
We hosted the second edition of the annual ReFi Kenya festival in September. This is part of our outreach efforts to build a local regenerative community in the country. The festival brought together technology builders and land stewards to discuss how ReFi can scale across Kenya.
We consider community building to be an essential part of scaling regeneration projects. Festivals such as ReFi Kenya are laying the groundwork for an indigenous ReFi culture to spread countrywide. Part of the funds from our GG18 round went to supporting this festival which is planned to be even bigger next year.
Read more at this link:
ReFi Kenya link
Since the last round, we've also held meetings to onboard more small farmers onto the ReFi tools we've developed. The impact of all these outreach activities is that more people get to learn about and join regenerative projects.
We continue to develop our dMRV solution and test it locally. While aspects of it are ready (such as what is used for climate adaptation) parts of it are still a work in progress. In particular, we are still building and training models around carbon stock quantification for carbon credit verification. Our goal is to make this available as a

metadata.document_title: "Revolutionizing Sustainable Agriculture with ExoSmart: Leveraging IoT, Blockchain, and Carbon Neutrality for a Greener Future"
metadata.questions_this_excerpt_can_answer:
1. How does ExoSmart utilize IoT and blockchain technology to track, report, and reduce greenhouse gas emissions in agriculture?
2. What are the benefits of ExoSmart's real-time emission monitoring, blockchain-powered certification, and data-driven insights for the agricultural community?
3. In what ways can individuals support ExoSmart's mission of revolutionizing sustainable agriculture and achieving carbon neutrality through crowdfunding and educational initiatives?

__data__.text:
Be a part of a groundbreaking movement with ExoSmart, where advanced Internet of Things (IoT) meets blockchain technology to revolutionize sustainable agriculture. Our mission is to empower the agricultural community to effectively combat climate change and achieve carbon neutrality.
ExoSmart is a state-of-the-art platform combining IoT and blockchain technology to enable accurate tracking, reporting, and reduction of greenhouse gas emissions in agriculture. This project is a leap forward towards an eco-friendly, transparent, and accountable food production system.
Real-Time Emission Monitoring: Advanced IoT sensors provide real-time data on agricultural emissions with witness proofs directly on the blockchain using on-chip hardware wallet.
Blockchain-Powered Certification: Utilizes blockchain technology for transparent and tamper-proof carbon certification.
Data-Driven Insights: Delivers actionable intelligence to reduce carbon footprint and enhance crop productivity.
User-Friendly Interface: Accessible technology, catering to all levels of tech expertise in the farming community.
Regulatory Compliance: Assists users in meeting environmental regulations and achieving carbon neutrality.
Environmental: Significantly lowers agriculture's carbon footprint, contributing to global climate action.
Societal: Facilitates a shift towards sustainable agriculture, promoting healthier food systems and adherence to global sustainability initiatives.
Economic: Boosts market competitiveness for agricultural businesses through eco-friendly and certified practices.
Crowdfunding connects us with a global community passionate about environmental sustainability and technological innovation. Your support is pivotal in developing, refining, and expanding the reach of ExoSmart, bringing this revolutionary solution to farmers and businesses worldwide.
Your support is vital in various ways:
Technology Development: Funding will enhance the integration of IoT and blockchain for robust carbon certification.
Global Outreach: Enables us to introduce ExoSmart to a broader audience, promoting widespread adoption.
Educational Initiatives: Supports training and educational resources for optimal utilization of ExoSmart.
Contributors will receive exclusive perks, including insider updates, carbon farming e-books, access to industry specific blockchain training courses, and special invitations to ExoSmart demonstration events.
Support ExoSmart in creating a sustainable, carbon-neutral future for agriculture. Your contribution is an investment in the health of our planet and a testament to your commitment to environmental stewardship.
twitter:exoblockbv

metadata.document_title: Empowering Climate Action through Decentralized Prediction Markets: xParametric's Innovative Approach
metadata.questions_this_excerpt_can_answer:
1. How does xParametric's decentralized climate prediction market incentivize active engagement in climate action and increase awareness about climate change?
2. What specific climate risks can participants trade outcome shares for on xParametric's platform, and how does the Fixed Product Market Maker (FPMM) facilitate these transactions?
3. How has participation in prediction markets, such as xParametric, been shown to impact individuals' awareness and concern about global warming, according to a study published in Nature Climate Change by Cerf, Matz, and MacIver (2023)?

__data__.text:
xParametric is a decentralized climate prediction market that enables individuals and organizations to transfer or invest in climate risks. It encourages participants to stay informed about climate change and foster a heightened sense of climate concern by giving them a direct stake in the outcome of climate-related events. This direct involvement incentivizes active engagement in climate action and reinforces the importance of addressing climate challenges.

Participants can trade outcome shares that represent climate risks such as rising sea levels, increasing temperatures and extreme weather events. xParametric's Fixed Product Market Maker (FPMM) facilitates the buying, selling and holding of these shares, enabling you to make decisions based on your own beliefs. Users and institutions can also transfer climate risks by participating in markets that are relevant to their climate risk exposure.

Participation in prediction markets has been shown to enhance awareness and concern about global warming. A recent study by Cerf, Matz, and MacIver (2023), published in Nature Climate Change, found that individuals who participated in these markets exhibited increased awareness and heightened apprehension about the impacts of global warming.

Funding for the xParametric project would accelerate platform development and enhance user experience. We are currently in closed alpha for selected testers and expect to launch our public version in 2024.
Website | Twitter | Medium | Docs
twitter:x_parametric

metadata.document_title: Empowering Northern Nigerian Youth Through Tree Planting and School Campaigns for Environmental Conservation: A Comprehensive Approach to Sustainable Development
metadata.questions_this_excerpt_can_answer:
1. How many trees does the Green Planet Conservation Initiative aim to plant in Northern Nigeria by 2030 through their school campaign program?
2. What specific environmental challenges are facing Northern Nigeria, as mentioned in the document?
3. How does the Green Planet Conservation Initiative plan to empower school children in Northern Nigeria through tree planting and environmental conservation efforts?

__data__.text:
Project Overview
Climate change is a global phenomenon that has far-reaching effects on the environment. Northern Nigeria is no exception to this.
Extreme weather patterns—fiercer, longer dry seasons and shorter, more intense rainy seasons—are exacerbating challenges confronting local communities. Extensive cultivation and overgrazing have been compounded by desertification, soil erosion, and other environmental problems that have affected the livelihoods of people living in the region
Problem
Continuous deforestation is happening in Northern Nigeria because of the need for food, medicine, charcoal, and timber. The loss of tree cover in a rainy, mountainous area has had severe environmental consequences. In addition to tremendous loss of biodiversity, the region experiences soil degradation, erosion, desertification and landslides.
Specific focus with this grant funding
Our goal is to plant 1 million trees in Northern Nigeria by 2030 through our school campaign program that is aimed to reach 10,000 students in the region. We will achieve this by partnering with local organizations, schools, and communities to promote tree planting and environmental conservation. We will also provide educational resources and training to teachers and students to help them understand the importance of environmental conservation. Our specific focus is on empowering school children on tree planting
Solution
Climate change is a global challenge that requires collective action to mitigate its effects. One way to address this issue is through tree planting and school campaigns. By providing environmental skills and knowledge to rural school children, the children will be empowered to protect their local environment.
Why we need your Support
Our vision is to create a sustainable future for generations to come by promoting tree planting and school campaigns. We believe that by planting trees, we can help to mitigate the effects of climate change and create a more sustainable environment. We also believe that by raising awareness about environmental conservation through school campaigns, we can inspire young people to take action and make a positive impact on the world.
Because of the awareness created by this project, the children and the community will learn to nurture the trees, and not cut them down. The knowledge of planting and protecting the trees will be passed on to the next generations. If this project succeeds, we will identify additional sectors in which trees can be planted, and spread our good work.

metadata.document_title: Advancing Geospatial Standards and Tools in the Decentralized Web3 Ecosystem
metadata.questions_this_excerpt_can_answer:
1. How is Astral advancing geospatial standards and tools in the decentralized Web3 ecosystem?
2. What are the key components of the Astral Protocol and how do they contribute to building location-based apps on the decentralized web?
3. What specific projects and initiatives has Astral led or been involved in since its founding, and how do they align with the mission of empowering climate- and sustainability-related Web3 builders to work with spatial and location data?

__data__.text:
At Astral we see a world where humanity has the geospatial technologies and tools needed to monitor and govern life with dignity.
Our mission is to make it possible to build location-based apps on the decentralized web. We're doing this by researching and developing a set of open source standards and software tools that help Web3 developers work with geospatial data.
The Astral Protocol has three components:
Verifiable spatial data registries — smart contract-based registries of spatial features like points, lines, polygons and raster images;
Verifiable location credentials, to serve as presence claims in the Astral ecosystem, and
Web3-native geospatial data technologies so the data backing these systems is user-controlled, cryptographically verifiable, uncensorable and permanent.
Since the project was founded, we have focused on building open source standards and tools, and have been fully funded through public goods funding and grants.
We've develop and led several projects, including:
Kolektivo GeoNFTs, which serve as an on-chain spatial data registry
Hyperaware, a spatial governance protocol for connected devices targeted at transport and mobility applications
Sprout, an early ReFi proof-of-concept sustainability-linked bond in Solidity that aligns loan terms to environmental metrics
Spatial.sol, a library of geometric and topological functions in Solidity
GeoLocker, a prototype verifiable spatial data registry built on Ethereum and 3Box
These are linked components that will enable the ecosystem to build a Web3 map of the world, and location-based dapps that use that map. Our work is primarily focused on building core infrastructure and open source standards to enable and empower climate- and sustainability-related Web3 builders to work with spatial and location data.
Astral tools and standards will be useful in a range of different use cases including:
Regenerative project development and dMRV
DAOs / digital governance: geofenced local and regional DAOs, local currencies, spatial demurrage
Mobility: defining policy areas like congestion zones, capturing the position of connected devices like IoT and smartphones
Natural capital currencies: defining ecological zones, storing physical measurements of ecosystem conditions
Metaverse / gaming: virtual land registries like Decentraland and Cryptovoxels, and AR games like Pokemon Go
Grant contributions will fund the development team building these public

metadata.document_title: "Joy's Kitchen: Rescuing Food, Empowering Communities, and Promoting Sustainability Through Sustainable Practices"
metadata.questions_this_excerpt_can_answer:
1. How many families does Joy's Kitchen in Colorado provide meals for each month?
2. What percentage of food in retail chains in Colorado ends up as waste, and what are the primary reasons for this waste?
3. How does Joy's Kitchen aim to address food insecurity and food waste at the grassroots level in Colorado, and what are their primary goals in achieving this mission?

__data__.text:
Joy’s Kitchen is a Colorado-based 501(c)(3) non-profit organization dedicated to addressing food insecurity and food waste at the grassroots level. With the help of our 420-strong volunteer force, we rescue, sort, and distribute food to thousands of families in need across the state. By providing nourishing groceries, fostering a supportive environment, and promoting sustainable practices, we build meaningful connections and empower change within our communities.
Our mission is to rescue and redistribute surplus food to combat climate change and create a more sustainable and compassionate world. Through the dedication of our staff, volunteers, and supporters like you, we’ve been able to provide meals for over 6,000 families per month in Colorado. But there are still more families in need, and we need your help to reach them. Your generous donation can make a real difference in the lives of those who are struggling with food insecurity in our community.
In Colorado, a staggering 42% of food in retail chains ends up as waste, primarily due to overproduction. Limited store space, high consumer demands, and the pursuit of perfect-looking products contribute to this issue.
Unsold food, amounting to over 80 billion pounds annually in America, is discarded in landfills. According to the nonprofit ReFED, more than a third of all food grown for human consumption in the United States never reaches a plate. This wasted food represents $408 billion worth of resources, grown on 18% of U.S. farmland and using 4 trillion tons of water.
We envision a world where no one goes hungry, and food is used wisely. Our purpose is to support food security, promote environmentally-conscious practices, and shape the future by inspiring change.
Our primary goals include:
Rescuing and redistributing nutritious food to over 6,000 families per month, ensuring access to wholesome meals for those in need.
Collaborating with local businesses, donors, and volunteers to support our food rescue efforts and community programs.
Educating and raising awareness about food waste, hunger, and sustainable practices to inspire individual and collective action.
Promoting inclusivity, community engagement, and shared responsibility in addressing food security and environmental challenges.
By focusing on these goals, Joy’s Kitchen strives to make a lasting impact on the lives of families in Colorado, fostering

metadata.document_title: Empowering Indigenous Women in Brazil: Avelin Buniacá Kambiwá's Journey of Decolonization, Technology, and Cultural Preservation
metadata.questions_this_excerpt_can_answer:
1. How is Mycelia empowering Indigenous women in Brazil through decolonization, technology, and cultural preservation?
2. What specific initiatives and campaigns has Avelin Buniacá Kambiwá been involved in to support Indigenous women in Brazil?
3. How is Web3 technology being utilized to support Indigenous Public Goods and amplify the voices of Indigenous Peoples, particularly Indigenous women in Brazil?

__data__.text:
For the end of 2023, we wanted to focus GG19 on the work and passion of Avelin Buniacá Kambiwá who are defending the rights of Indigenous Women in Brazil
👉 You can find a Portuguese version here 👈
Mycelia is weaving the Human Bioma, from the ancestrality of Indigenous Peoples, to the infinity of Web3. We believe that Indigenous Peoples are the one that can help humanity to face ecosystem collapse, biodiversity losses and foster a global culture that reconnects us to the fabric of life — their mission on Earth is a real public good for humanity.
To achieve this, Indigenous Peoples are asking for more self-determination, and Web3 is delivering them.
Mycelia considers Indigenous Missions as a real public good that can address complex challenges, we want Web3 to support them.
We are working to support Indigenous Public Goods (IPGs) and find ways to make their voices louder in Web3.
Brazil's Indigenous Women are at the heart of societal shift, but are still among the poorest and most mistreated populations in the world. This campaign is focused to support research on the importance of Indigenous Women in Brazil and how technology could help them.
Avelin Buniacá Kambiwá, co-founder of Mycelia, will coordinate this campaign in the name of all Indigenous Women she is working with, and will raise her voice in Gitcoin Radio.
During the Beta Round and GG18 we were looking at how to bridge Indigenous causes to Web3. Our last discovery was to consider their mission as a real public good. This economic approach of Indigenous Public Goods is to encourage funding of Indigenous Projects through allocation mechanisms such as Grant Stack and other Web3 primitives.
In this context, we want more R&D to gain maturity around concepts such as Indigenous Public Goods and to develop a grounded narrative for sponsors and projects wishing to fund Indigenous Public Goods. **This is the reason why we are focusing GG19 on the work of Avelin Buniacá Kambiwá.
Other work since GG18:


Gitcoin Citizens with Mathilde as a translator of the Indigenous Voices in Gitcoin;
A Giveth Campaign and support and preparation for Artizen Season

Avelin Buniacá Kambiwá is a Brazilian indigenous woman, a member of the Kambiwá people, based in the hinterland of Pernambuco, North of Brazil. As an Indigenous Person in diaspora, Avelin today lives in Belo Horizonte, Minas Gerais.
🐆 Indigenous — The Kambiwá are Indigenous People living in the northeastern Brazilian state of Pernambuco (Kambiwá meaning “return to Serra Negra", a sacred mountain they were expelled from that is central to their identity). They are remnants of several Indigenous groups that inhabited the region's mountains and were persecuted and expelled by colonizers starting in the 17th century. Today around 3,100 Kambiwá live in several villages in the municipalities of Ibimirim, Inajá and Floresta and still preserve rituals such as the Praiá and Toré dances, and value their elders' knowledge and oral traditions where spirituality is very important for their ethnic identity. You want to learn more about the Kambiwá Peoples ? 👉👉 The Kambiwá People
🔎 Researcher — Researcher in the area of human rights, with a focus on Indigenous and Women's rights. Avelin has a degree in Social Sciences from the Methodist University of São Paulo and is currently studying for a master's degree in the Postgraduate Program in Occupation Studies at the Federal University of Minas Gerais.

__data__.text:
:Avelin Kambiwá
The aim of Avelin's research within Mycelia is to highlight the importance of Indigenous Cultures, with a specific focus on Indigenous Women in Brazil and how technologies (especially Web3) could help them to preserve their self-determination and protect their rights. Avelin has been working on this research since June 2023.
The first angle of her research was to study decolonization in the socio-cultural behavior of contemporary Indigenous organizations.
Setting up interviews with Indigenous Institutions : Retornando a Mãe terra: a descolonização do pensamento e das nossas organizações
Avelin :  “This first study encountered a number of difficulties due to the lack of access to a stable Internet network. Because they are located in the Roraima forest region, in the territory of the Yanomami people, even closer to Boa Vista. In general, the region suffers from poor Internet connectivity and the few, precarious data services available, which, while limited in scope and quality, are extremely costly for any indigenous community”.
➡ ️ The conclusion is that the reality with technology is really complex for Indigenous Peoples in LATAM, and it can only be achieved with a minimal investment on Internet Infrastructure and a formation.
“The sacredness of the female being in various cultures has been suppressed for the purposes of domination in a system in crisis, resulting in a rupture of women's fundamental link with the land and their territory”. Defending Indigenous Women rights might be the ultimate way to regenerate the world and preserve future generations.
For this second research angle we also started to show Avelin how to use Claude-AI from Antropic, so far it has been a great experience for her, and opens new questions on how AI could assist Indigenous Peoples to defend their rights.

metadata.EGS Provider: MesoReefDAO - Regenerating Reef Conservation with DeSci Web3 tools
metadata.document_title: "Empowering Collaborative and Transdisciplinary Conservation Efforts for Regenerative Coral Reef Conservation: The MesoReefDAO Approach"
metadata.questions_this_excerpt_can_answer:
1. How is MesoReefDAO working to establish partnerships with local communities, NGOs, and governments to support sustainable fishing practices and the development of marine protected areas in the Mesoamerican Reef?
2. What specific regenerative practices, big data analytics, and decentralized technologies is MesoReefDAO implementing to achieve its mission of restoring, protecting, preserving, and conserving the Mesoamerican Reef ecosystem?
3. What are the key factors contributing to the rapid deterioration of the Mesoamerican Reef System that MesoReefDAO is aiming to solve/mitigate through its conservation efforts?

metadata.EGS Provider: MesoReefDAO - Regenerating Reef Conservation with DeSci Web3 tools

__data__.text:
Mesoamerican Reef DAO (MesoReefDAO) is a Regenerative Coral Reef Science initiative that focuses on the creation of a Decentralized Autonomous Organization (DAO) of DeSci (Decentralized Science) that seeks to scale coral reef conservation efforts in the Mesoamerican Reef (MAR).
The Mesoamerican Reef is indeed the second-largest coral reef system in the world, spanning over 600 miles along the coasts of Mexico, Belize, Guatemala, and Honduras (Fig 1). It is an incredibly diverse and ecologically important ecosystem, providing habitat for thousands of species that support ecological goods and services.

Fig 1. A map of the Mesoamerican Reef, © WWF Guatemala.
MesoReefDAO is working to establish partnerships with local communities, NGOs, and governments to support the implementation of sustainable fishing practices and the development of marine protected areas in the MAR. The DAO believes that engaging local communities in conservation efforts is crucial for the long-term sustainability of the region (Fig 2).

Fig 2. MesoReefDAO General Framework.
Mission
The MesoReef DAO aims to restore, protect, preserve, and conserve the Mesoamerican Reef ecosystem, working towards the United Nations Decade of Restoration framework, through the implementation of regenerative practices, big data analytics, and decentralized technologies. We will foster a decentralized and collaborative management system to ensure a sustainable future for the reef and the people that depend on it.

The MesoReef DAO envisions a future where the Mesoamerican Reef ecosystem is thriving, providing ecological and economic benefits to local communities and visitors. We will achieve this by restoring degraded coral habitats, improving water quality, reducing pollution, promoting sustainable fishing practices, and educating local communities and visitors.
Problem

Problem
The problem that MesoReefDAO is trying to solve/mitigate is the rapid deterioration of the Mesoamerican Reef System due to climate change, pollution, overfishing, biodiversity loss, and other human activities. The Mesoamerican Reef System is one of the most biodiverse and economically important coral reef systems in the world, providing critical habitat for numerous species of marine life and supporting the livelihoods of millions of people in the region.
However, the reef system is under significant threat in the Anthropocene. The current approaches to address these issues have not been sufficient, with a lack of coordination between stakeholders, insufficient funding, and limited implementation of scientific research and data-driven decision-making.

Fig 3. Coral Outplanting areas in the Mexican Caribbean.

MesoReefDAO aimed to mitigate the problems facing the Mesoamerican Reef through decentralized science web3 tools, community engagement, and leveraging the power of blockchain technology. As a DAO, MesoReefDAO is governed by its members, who collectively make decisions and allocate resources based on a set of rules and protocols encoded on the blockchain.
The framework model is centered around creating a decentralized, transparent, and sustainable system of funding and decision-making for regenerate coral reef conservation efforts in the Mesoamerican Reef System (Fig 4).

Fig 4. Six-layer framework (a-f) for “Web3” DeSci DAOs, adapted from Ding, et al., (2022).
Create regenerative feedbacks in coral reef conservation throughout the MAR (Fig 5).

In this proposal, we aim to further develop and expand the capabilities of MesoReefDAO through the Climate Solutions category of the Gitcoin Grants program.
Our proposed project includes:
Explore and potentially build a user-friendly interface for MesoReefDAO: A well-designed interface will help to attract more users and make it easier for them to contribute to conservation efforts. The interface will also provide transparency into the decision-making process and the allocation of funds.
Developing a regenerative decentralized science (DeSci) offset program for the MAR: Climate change is one of the biggest threats to the MAR. To mitigate its impact, we plan to create a community-based decentralized science offset program that will incentivize individuals and organizations to reduce their carbon footprint and contribute to MAR conservation efforts. The program will be transparently managed through MesoReefDAO.
Partnering with coral reef scientists: We aim to collaborate with coral reef scientists to identify and prioritize conservation efforts based on scientific research. This will ensure that the funds raised through MesoReefDAO are used in the most effective and impactful way possible.
Implementing smart contracts: Smart contracts will be used to automate the distribution of funds and ensure transparency and accountability. This will eliminate the need for intermediaries and reduce the risk of fraud and mismanagement.

MesoReefDAO aims to collaborate with a wide range of stakeholders including scientists, the private sector, local communities, academia, non-governmental organizations (NGOs), and government entities. Through these collaborations, MesoReefDAO aims to leverage the power of blockchain and DeSci DAOs to drive positive change to local communities and create synergies between sectors to address the challenges faced by coral reefs and the MAR. By bringing together diverse perspectives and expertise, MesoReefDAO seeks to foster innovation and develop effective solutions for coral reef conservation and restoration.
MesoReefDAO is committed to promoting Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) in all aspects of our project, including collaboration. We believe that diversity in perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences leads to more innovative solutions and better outcomes. We actively seek out partnerships and collaborations with individuals and organizations that share our values and commitment to DEI. We are open to working with a wide range of stakeholders, including those from underrepresented communities, to ensure that our project benefits and uplifts everyone. We recognize that DEI is an ongoing process and are committed to continuously learning, growing, and improving in this area.
Contact us on social media of MesoReefDAO if you want to get involved.

metadata.document_title: BÚAN_fund: Ethereum-based Land Conservation and Biodiversity Restoration Initiative Proposal
metadata.questions_this_excerpt_can_answer:
1. How does BÚAN_fund use Ethereum technology to secure land for biodiversity conservation and restoration?
2. What is the significance of the Site Specific Stewardship Agreement in the BÚAN_fund initiative?
3. How many hectares of land are currently under stewardship agreements with BÚAN_fund, and what is their plan for further expansion and onboarding of new sites?

metadata.EGS Provider: MesoReefDAO - Regenerating Reef Conservation with DeSci Web3 tools

__data__.text:
BÚAN_fund is an Ethereum based framework to secure land for the benefit of biodiversity, restoring and regenerating nature.
We mint impact certificates backed by the land in our treasury to support landowners who have signed our Site Specific Stewardship Agreement'. The SSSA verifies they are the owners of the land and stipulates management actions that they agree to implement.
Currently we have 50 hectares with stewardship agreements and many more hectares beginning their onboarding process. Completing orthomosaic maps of the first sites is now the priority.
A lot of work has been done to pull together all of the data we have into a clean and compact explorer that we are excited to share with you.
twitter:buan_fund

metadata.document_title: "Building Regenerative Urban Spaces: A Global Network for Sustainable Design and Community Transformation"
metadata.questions_this_excerpt_can_answer:
1. How has Kula Earth Regenerative Commons been working locally with change-makers and communities to co-create the initial conditions for regenerative livelihoods to emerge?
2. What initiatives and experiments have been led by Kula Earth Regenerative Commons that transcend borders and cultural differences globally?
3. What specific features and initiatives have been implemented at the Bangalore Sacred Sanctuary to serve as a pioneering model for urban regenerative safe spaces?

__data__.text:
Our mission is to foster deeper belonging and the right relationships to nature through regenerative design. For the past 3 months Kula Earth Regenerative Commons, we have been working locally with change-makers and communities to co-create the initial conditions for regenerative livelihoods to emerge, guided by the principles of deep ecology that has lead us to rebrand in a way that is more transparent. Our initiatives that are being experimented and iterated on are led locally but transcend borders and cultural differences globally.
We choose path less traveled...

We stand at the forefront of deep ecology prioritizing its profound interconnectedness over surface-level, shallow ecology. Treating every place and every being with respect, we choose love over fear, and champion the diversity of permaculture over the uniformity of monoculture. We aren’t just creating sanctuaries; we’re nurturing anti-fragile communities prepared for a future entangled with nature.
In the bustling urban landscape of Bangalore, Kula Earth's vision has come to life with a transformation that speaks volumes about our dedication to ecological and social restoration. We have doubled our efforts over recent months at the Bangalore Sacred Sanctuary, creating not just a green refuge, but a dynamic hub for urban regeneration. This sanctuary serves as a pioneering model for urban regenerative safe spaces—places where community, ecology, and sustainable living intertwine seamlessly.
The platform, inspired and empowered by a Kula Earth and Atlantis collaborative initiative, serves as a virtual twin of the Bangalore Sacred Sanctuary and others, offering a global template for urban ecological restoration. Here's how:
Interactive Mapping: Users can explore and visualize the evolution of green spaces in urban settings, following the Bangalore Sanctuary's blueprint for regenerative design.
Community-Centric Bounties: Aligning with Kula Earth's mission, the platform facilitates local and global collaboration on projects, drawing from the collective wisdom and energy of sanctuary supporters.
Hybrid Workshops and Storytelling: Through immersive experiences, we share the story of Bangalore's transformation, inspiring and educating global citizens on the possibilities of urban regeneration.
Nestled in the heart of India's Silicon Valley, the Bangalore Sacred Sanctuary is a testament to what can be achieved when we commit to working with nature rather than against it. In this space, we've seen:
A doubling of green spaces, creating

blueprint for regenerative design.

Hybrid Workshops and Storytelling: Through immersive experiences, we share the story of Bangalore's transformation, inspiring and educating global citizens on the possibilities of urban regeneration.
Nestled in the heart of India's Silicon Valley, the Bangalore Sacred Sanctuary is a testament to what can be achieved when we commit to working with nature rather than against it. In this space, we've seen:
A doubling of green spaces, creating pockets of biodiversity and reducing urban heat.
Community-driven initiatives that have led to increased local engagement and stewardship.
Educational programs that bridge the gap between urban living and ecological awareness.

We're not content with the status quo. In the last six months, we've amplified our impact, focusing on:
Deepening connections with local change-makers to catalyze regenerative livelihoods.
Elevating the narrative of regenerative urban spaces through the power of storytelling and art.
Expanding our global knowledge network, sharing insights from the Bangalore Sacred Sanctuary with the world, and integrating wisdom into our ever-evolving model.

Bangalore Sacred Sanctuary's success has sparked a global conversation. We've:

Built a model for urban sanctuaries that can be replicated worldwide.
Inspired similar initiatives in other cities, spreading the vision of urban regeneration.
Championed a shift from monoculture to rich, diverse, and sustainable ecosystems even in urban settings.
With additional funding, we will:
Scale our urban sanctuary model to new regions, adapting and refining our approach.
Strengthen community engagement, ensuring every urban dweller can contribute to and benefit from regenerative spaces.
Enhance our monitoring and evaluation to track the real-time impact and adapt our strategies for even greater efficacy.
Your support for Kula Earth Regenerative Commons GG19 is more than a donation—it's an investment in a greener, more resilient future. With each step forward at the Bangalore Sacred Sanctuary and beyond, we're crafting a world where urban spaces foster connection, community, and regeneration at every corner.
